title: Anti-abortion center’s lawsuit against Mass. officials gets tossed
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: A federal judge dismissed Your Options Medical's lawsuit against Massachusetts officials over a public education campaign.
Judge Leo T. Sorokin ruled the state's campaign did not infringe on Your Options Medical's constitutional rights.
Your Options Medical plans to appeal the decision, arguing the court misinterpreted the state's coordinated actions.

title: Bruins, Marco Sturm must do their ‘homework’ to fix team’s top flaw for stretch run
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: The Boston Bruins are focusing on improving their penalty kill, ranked 28th in the NHL with a 76.4% success rate.
Boston's head coach, Marco Sturm, emphasizes reducing penalties to boost the team's performance in the season's final stretch.
The Bruins are currently in a wild-card playoff spot with a record of 32-20-5, four points ahead in the Eastern Conference.

title: This Boston Marathon bombing survivor is running with Miles for Miracles
author: Autumn Sloboda
bullets: Juliana Hermenegildo, a Boston Marathon bombing survivor, is running the 2026 Boston Marathon with the Miles for Miracles team.
Hermenegildo aims to raise money for Boston Children's Hospital, inspired by her son's successful heart surgery there in 2024.
Her participation also marks a personal milestone, returning to the marathon after experiencing trauma during the 2013 bombing.

title: Teaming up with Al Horford against Celtics will be ‘weird,’ Kristaps Porzingis says
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Kristaps Porzingis and Al Horford, former Celtics players, join Golden State Warriors, facing their ex-team Thursday night.
Porzingis returns after injuries for first Warriors game, expressing 'weird' feeling facing Celtics with Horford.
Al Horford appreciates personal connections with Celtics, optimistic about Warriors' offense and West Coast move.

title: Celtics reportedly bring back Dalano Banton on 10-day contract
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: The Boston Celtics signed Dalano Banton to a 10-day contract; he previously played for the team in 2024.
Banton, 26, appeared in two games with the Clippers this season and averaged 6.7 points across five NBA seasons.
Rookie guard John Tonje was also signed to a 10-day contract, averaging 18.8 points in the G-League this season.

title: Here’s why Ed Markey is boycotting the State of the Union — and what he and others are doing instead
author: Samantha Genzer
bullets: Senator Ed Markey will boycott President Trump's State of the Union address, attending the People's State of the Union rally.
The rally is organized by MoveOn and MeidasTouch to oppose Trump's policies; attendees include lawmakers and affected citizens.
House Minority Leader Hakeem Jeffries suggests Democrats sit silently or boycott, though Rep. Seth Moulton plans to attend.

title: South Boston St. Patrick’s Parade to follow new route for 250th Evacuation Day
author: Samantha Genzer
bullets: South Boston's St. Patrick’s Day Parade will start at Andrew Square, altering its route to commemorate Evacuation Day.
The parade route honors Henry Knox’s historical march, aligning with the 250th anniversary of the British evacuation from Boston.
A new 'family-friendly zone' will be designated at Medal of Honor Park to accommodate larger expected crowds.

title: New England has the best open-air and maritime museums in America, according to USA Today readers
author: Kristi Palma
bullets: Plimoth Patuxet Museums in Plymouth, Mass. was named the No. 1 open-air museum in America by USA Today readers.
Maine Maritime Museum in Bath, Maine topped USA Today's list of the best maritime museums in the country.
Concord Museum in Concord, Mass. was ranked No. 2 small town museum in America in USA Today's 10Best Readers’ Choice Awards.

title: Second worker exposed to gas at Maine pulp mill dies
author: Samantha Genzer
bullets: Allen Hornberger, 26, died nearly three weeks after being exposed to toxic gas at Woodland Pulp Mill in Baileyville, Maine.
The incident on January 27 occurred as workers were shutting down operations, resulting in exposure to a gas inhalation hazard.
Kasie Malcolm, a University of Maine student and intern at the mill, also died following the gas exposure incident.

title: Warriors’ Stephen Curry to miss Thursday’s game against the Celtics
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Stephen Curry will miss Thursday's game against the Boston Celtics due to a knee injury.
Curry, who has been sidelined since January 30, has missed 16 games this season with runner's knee.
Former Celtic Krastaps Porzingis will make his debut for the Warriors, and Al Horford is set to play.
